Reviews.Title: “simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: brenda a
Reviews.Content: I had to stay here as my home was too small for my friends and also on their behalf, I would like to thank the hotel management and staff for a wonderful stay at this unique hotel. What we all liked particularly was its serene almost meditative atmosphere which suits well to the eternal city. two of my friends did not like it very much that they had to walk too far to their room but in the end we were all very satisfied with all its services. We will tell all our friends of course to stay there when they visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: beausmom1
Reviews.Content: This property is in a good location - close to San Pietro train station, Saint Peters Basilca, Vatican Museums and many dining options. You have to walk up a steep hill to get to the hotel. The room accommodations are spartan, but clean and very adequate. The meals in the hotel dining room were good and there is free wireless in the lobby. The staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Review based on my stay as a 17 year old in 1973”
Reviews.Author: sanfranciscoconejo
Reviews.Content: I havent been to Italy since 1973 when I had turned 17. I went to Europe for two months with other high school students. It was awesome. I stayed at this hotel. All our meals were at this hotel. It was very economical probably under ten dollars a day. I remember the meals being included a huge plate of pasta and a meat dish and wine!! I had beer or wine with every meal. Me and my friends hit on the girls who worked here serving meals,etc until we realized that they were nuns in training. What a waste. The hotel was very close to the Vatican which was just down the hill. There really was a lot to do and we walked everywhere. Nice to know it still exists. I would love to make my way up the hill soon. Lots of memories.

Reviews.Title: “Great with private parkinv”
Reviews.Author: Zanneskov
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel due to the private parking. It was great for foreigners with a rented car in Rome :0) the hotel is quite close to S. Pietro. The hotel was a bit anonymous -but we had everything we needed though. The hotel even offered us a breakfast to go, since we had a very early flight

Reviews.Title: “just great!”
Reviews.Author: mozartkugeln
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this lovely medium sized hotel was just perfect . This is a very clean, friendly and family type hotel ( probably also run by a family!!!! ) with wonderful, calm and almost spiritual atmosphere. The rooms are very nicely laid out and staff members are super helpful. Its a short walk to the vatican city although the walk back is a bit strenuous due to the somewhat steep climb. Plenty of restaurants around but dinner in the house is also excellent and reasonably priced. We will endeavour to go back to Casa tra noi everytime we go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, superb custumer service”
Reviews.Author: farfalla0217
Reviews.Content: Custumer service is excellent, welcoming, ready to help with family needs. it is located on top of a hill but next to train station with easy access to Termini

Reviews.Title: “Good service and very clean.”
Reviews.Author: MimaDomenica
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel. the rooms were always very clean and they were always very helpful and friendly. We had a great view from the 3rd floor seeing the St. Peter. The supper at the hotel were delicious. Try it. Maria from Montreal

Reviews.Title: “I loved this place”
Reviews.Author: Thorin_2
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. Great location and price. Clean and functional. Safe neighborhood. A hidden jem. Walking distance to St. Peter's Cathedral. Placed at the top of a hill so may be difficult for eldery/impaired unless you take a taxi back up. I really don't get the negative reviews. Drink machines not working? I mean really, stop being so spoiled. Walk down a block and drink COLD tap water spilling right into the street from those frequent fountains (took me a while to realize what those were!) I loved Rome and would stay at Casa Tra Noi again if at all possible.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Tra Noi: The Hotel California's Rome Branch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, the good news: The rooms are ample in size, and clean. The bathrooms are good, and the showers have great water pressure. It's nice having a bar on hand, and the hill is not that steep, easily manageable unless you're elderly, ill or have mobility problems. The chapels and meeting rooms are nice. Now the downside: The promised air conditioning was not working when we were there, and no one seemed too concerned about it, though it was pretty hot out. Leaving the windows open at night left us prey to mosquitos, and there were no fans available. There are no phones in the rooms, just internal phones for wake-up calls, though there are phones in the public rooms. The drinks machine was also broken the whole time we were there. The food was institutional -- cheap, but in one of the great food capitals of the world, it seems a shame to dine on the equivalent of hospital cafeteria food. And the service ranged from indifferent to hostile. You can save a lot of money staying at this hotel. But if you need to save money that badly, consider staying home. Or going to Rome for a couple days, and then moving on to some of the other, less costly but heartbreakingly beautiful places Italy has to offer. You can get by at Casa Tra Noi, and if you're one of those people who don't much care where you sleep, go for it. I just found it depressing.

Reviews.Title: “Peace in a Noisy City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Better than most 3 & 4 star hotels. This is a religious house with the best of all worlds. It's close to St. Peter's, but at the top of a hill where it is quiet. You won't be awaken by motor scooters in the middle of the night. Don't expect quiet in the dinning room or lounge areas. While we were there a German church group was staying. No problem for us. We just joined in the laughter. Take advantage of the half board option. The meals are served family style and it's not chi-chi gourmet, but it's good, and satisfying. A great deal for the price. Wine and beer are available in the dinning room, but the best deal is the vending machine with small bottles of wine for 1 Euro. A small bar area serves drinks and espresso. There is a public bus that comes 3/4 up the hill. We didn't ride it up much, but many buses stop at the base of the hill and the San Pietro train station is at the base of the hill. There is a small grocery store with good food just a couple of blocks down from the hotel. If you want to make a picnic lunch this is a good place to go. I bought bottles of wine to take back home (2 Euros each) and have wine experts rave about the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have twice taken groups to Casa Tra Noi. The location is excellent. The facilities are very good. The food prices are within reason, the quality is acceptable. There is a bar in the lobby and the coffee is very good. The rooms are well appointed. A/C and large batherooms. Very clean. There are also good views. A large TV room and meeting room is available and a chapel is part of the complex. Security is good. The walk to Vatican is 10 minutes. The walk back is longer because the guest house is located on a hill and the climb up the street is an effort....but well worth the quality of the property. The train station is a five minute walk. The staff is very helpful. This is a very fine property for groups or singles. I recommend it without reservation. It is popular so plan ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great position!”
Reviews.Author: annieandcrew
Reviews.Content: Though rooms are small, they are clean and good value. Excellent position within easy walk of Vatican city (Piazza di San Pietro entrance) and San Pietro train station. Good, cheap food and a lovely atmosphere.

HotelInfo.Name: Casa Tra Noi
HotelInfo.Address: Via Monte del Gallo, 113, 00165 Rome, Italy
